messages: a965fe34034879fe521e2e3ae6552da8 (13:43): how can i enable the syntax highlight for html when a buffer contains some html-like code but is not loaded from a *.html file so the syntax is not enabled by default?
29b7430fa96bbc1bd8e3bfe51a58d125 (13:48): :set ft=html
febd9d49ffac1cd1ff2eba9a9a22a8d2 (14:10): morning!
febd9d49ffac1cd1ff2eba9a9a22a8d2 (14:10): question: can i change the font that is used for all the tabs? (tabnew, ...)
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): vim doesn't have "fonts"
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): The terminal does
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): Or gvim does
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): But only one font for the whole screen
a8200d5c4c1f0d271c5a06e78c27513c (14:13): what's tabnew anyway?
febd9d49ffac1cd1ff2eba9a9a22a8d2 (14:13): ok, ... gvim was what i meant
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): Yeah that's the next question :)
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:13): It's that vim7 new^Wannoyance :)
febd9d49ffac1cd1ff2eba9a9a22a8d2 (14:14): indeed ... that it is
a8200d5c4c1f0d271c5a06e78c27513c (14:14): ah some vim7 foo
febd9d49ffac1cd1ff2eba9a9a22a8d2 (14:14): although i quite like it
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:15): I've yet to use it
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:15): But I just noticed that tabnext creates a new tab if you're in the right most tab
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:15): Instead of cycling
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:15): That's a bit odd...
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:26): i want to remove this ^M character, can someone please help me,
29b7430fa96bbc1bd8e3bfe51a58d125 (14:27): vbhanu: read the topic
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (14:33): recursively
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:34): dindinx, thanks, help is there in FAQ, will come back if i cannot understand it
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:39): dindinx, i tried :e ++ff=dos but it does not help, even unix and mac do not help
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:39): what could be wrong here?
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:40): I think I found a documentation bug, whereto do I send patches?
ad3a4d73813d0f378d8293785417ad23 (14:41): vbhanu, http://www.vi-improved.org/wiki/index.php/FileFormat
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:44): samuel, yeah this substitution works
02f0e29295fa06198cd7470772f7a162 (14:44): Hi, I use vim 7.0 under windows and sometimes I need to open unicode files
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:45): then again i have some problems
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:45): some weird ^@ comes up
02f0e29295fa06198cd7470772f7a162 (14:45): can I start gvim with a particulary "set=utf-8" in the command line ?
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:45): samuel, what could be wrong? ( please read the previous three messages )
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:47): vbhanu: don't use the \n
ad3a4d73813d0f378d8293785417ad23 (14:48): maybe in this : http://www.geocities.com/volontir/
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:48): vbhanu: :help s/\<CR>
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:48): vbhanu: that should clear it up
ad3a4d73813d0f378d8293785417ad23 (14:49): vbhanu,  try also to convert the file with the linux command dos2unix or unix2dos.
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:51): samuel, dos2unix removed the ^M but i wanted to introduce a newline at the end of it
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (14:52): Drahflow, nothing much happened, just the ^M got replaced by the text <CR>, yeah the text <CR>, the file format was wrong then, it was in DOS
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:56): vbhanu: I get you correct? You have a file with a lot of lines ending in ^M and you want all those removed?
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:57): vbhanu: if that's correct use :%s/
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:57): argl... wait my irc client ate the interesting part

20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (14:58): vbhanu: if that's correct use :%s/\r$/<press Ctrl-V><press Enter>/ then you'll optain newlines for every ^M killed... or just replace them with // if the line breaks after them already
bebb3685ab1b4970eaebea991574358d (15:02): is there anybody who use the xml plugin http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=301 ?
bebb3685ab1b4970eaebea991574358d (15:02): I have installed it on my vim 7.0 under XP
bebb3685ab1b4970eaebea991574358d (15:02): and when I open an xml file, nothing is folded
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (15:03): Drahflow, ah!! thanks it works
f7ac2021c258d54d4f0f6b0709881060 (15:03): i always used to try <press ctrl+M> for that stupid thing
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (15:06): samuel: ^M before end of line
20fbb9b3cde36d71209cf043444802c9 (15:06): the blue ^M of course, not the two chars ^ and M :)
55329f95b0bc8a9f8ce6c2042a7013a9 (15:06): I wonder why html is indented in the win32 version of vim, while not in the nix version of vim
55329f95b0bc8a9f8ce6c2042a7013a9 (15:07): C is indentend in both versions.
